title: Eliphaz’s Second Speech: Job Condemned Again
summary: Eliphaz accuses Job of speaking arrogantly and irreverently. He insists that suffering is the fate of the wicked and says Job’s words show he doesn’t fear God. He paints a grim picture of the fate of the ungodly.

faq.question: What is Eliphaz’s main argument?
faq.answer: That Job is speaking like a fool and must be suffering for his own wickedness.

faq.question: How does Eliphaz describe the wicked?
faq.answer: As always suffering, fearing, and ultimately destroyed by God.
